Skip Navigation

Located in the heart of Central Texas, The City of Nolanville is a growing, vibrant community that maintains a small town atmosphere. We strive to live up to our motto of  "A Great Place to Live".

Mayor and City Council Members

The City of Nolanville operates under a Council-Manager form of government. In this structure, elected City Council members establish policies for municipal operations, while the administrative responsibilities are managed by the City Manager, who is appointed by the City Council. The City Council consists of the Mayor and five (5) Council members, with each Council member assigned a numbered position from 1 through 5.

Nolanville City Council Meetings: Nolanville City Council Meetings are held on the first and third Thursday of every month at 6:00pm at the Municipal Building located at 101 North 5th Street Nolanville, Texas.

City Council - Comprehensive Plan Strategies

City Hall 101 North 5th Street Nolanville, TX 76559 Phone: (254) 698-6335 Fax (254) 698-2540
We strive to preserve our small town atmosphere while preparing for growth and future generations, to enhance the beautification of the city, embrace the diversity of its people, and improve the quality of life for our citizens. We aspire to be "A Great Place to Live". Promote the health, safety, and welfare of our citizens; add value to our community by planning for the future, and encourage community involvement. Being responsive to those we serve, while always striving to improve the quality of life for our citizens, and enhance our dedication towards making the City of Nolanville "A Great Place to Live".
